intro: Drymonia alloplectoides var. vallicola, commonly known as the valley drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in a fine, whitish pubescence. The plant produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
